questions.text: You notice the following instrument being used to monitor a primigravida in the first stage of labor.  What is the investigation being performed here?
questions.solution:
The image shows a cardiotocograph (electronic fetal monitor) that is used to perform cardiotocography in labor.

It can be used in both antenatal and intranatal mothers. It measures fetal heart rate and uterine contractions. It is used to perform the non-stress test (NST) in the antenatal period and cardiotocography during labor.

questions.text: During your OBG posting, one of the senior residents asks you to induce labor in a primigravida admitted at 40 weeks of gestation. Identify the following device that you can use for this purpose.
questions.solution:
This is an image of cervidil vaginal insert. It is used for cervical ripening and improves the Bishop's score.

It contains 10 mg of dinoprostone designed to release at a rate of approximately 0.3 mg/hr over 10-hours.

questions.text: The following instrument is used to augment labour in a 28-year-old primigravida via low rupture of membranes. Identify this instrument.
questions.solution:
The given instrument is Kocher's artery forceps and is identified by the presence of a single tooth at the tip.

Kocher's artery forceps are used to achieve hemostasis by holding bleeding vessels. They are also used in low rupture of membranes to augment labour or for the surgical induction of labour. 

The difference between artery forceps and needle holders is in the edge and smoothness of corrugations. Artery forceps have smooth edges and single lined corrugations whereas, needle holders have rough edges and crossed lines forming square to diamond shaped corrugations.

questions.text: A primigravida was diagnosed with a prolonged second stage of labor due to the fetus being in occipitoposterior position. The obstetrician decided to give a posterior mediolateral cut at the introitus to facilitate delivery. Which of the following instruments would she use for the same?
questions.solution:
The given scenario of prolonged second stage of labor can be managed by performing an episiotomy. In the given figure, the instrument marked as "D" corresponds to episiotomy scissors.

An episiotomy is done to prevent posterior extention leading to obstetric anal sphincteric injuries.

Related Pearl: Mediolateral Episiotomy

It begins within 3 mm of the midline in the posterior fourchette and is directed laterally at an angle of at least 60 degrees from the midline. This yields an incision of 45 degrees off the midline.

It is essentially an inflicted second-degree perineal tear.

Structures cut in mediolateral episiotomy:

  • Posterior vaginal wall
  • Superficial and deep transverse perineal muscles, bulbospongiosus and part of levator ani
  • Fascia covering those muscles
  • Transverse perineal branches of pudendal vessels and nerves
  • Subcutaneous tissue and skin

Advantage: Lesser risk of anal sphincter laceration, hence it is preferred over median episiotomy.

Disadvantage: Increased blood loss and causes more perineal pain and dyspareunia.

questions.text: The following instrument is used on an exhausted primigravida during crowning of the fetal head. Which of the following is false about this instrument?

choices.text: It can be used in caesarean sections.
It can be used to deliver aftercoming head in breech.
It is a type of outlet forceps.

questions.solution:
The given image shows Wrigley's forceps.

These are used as outlet forceps for the extraction of the fetal head. It is used to provide traction force. It can also be used in C-section for delivery of the baby.

The instrument is light and short due to a reduction in the length of the shanks and handles. It has a marked cephalic curve with a slight pelvic curve. 

Conditions that require to be fulfilled for the use of outlet forceps are:

  • The fetal scalp is visible without separating the labia (crowning)
  • The fetal skull has reached the pelvic floor, or is on the perineum
  • The sagittal suture is in the anteroposterior diameter or right or left occiput anterior or posterior position (rotation does not exceed 45°)

Note: Delivery of aftercoming head in breech is done with Pipers forceps.

Related Pearl: Obstetrics forceps

Commonly used forceps: 

1) Simpson forceps

  • The most commonly used types of forceps in outlet delivery.
  • Has elongated cephalic curve.
  • These are used when there is substantial molding of the fetal head.

2) Elliot forceps

  • Has an adjustable pin for regulating the lateral pressure on the handles.
  • They are used most often when there is minimal molding.
  • More suitable for outlet delivery.

3) Kielland forceps

  • Has small pelvic curve and a sliding lock.
  • Suitable for head with little molding.
  • The most common forceps used for rotational delivery.
  • Helps correct asynclitism.

4) Piper forceps

  • Distinct perineal curve.
  • Allows for application to the after-coming head in breech delivery.

5) Tucker-McLane forceps

  • Suitable for fetal head with little molding.
  • Used in rotational delivery.

6) Barton forceps and traction handle

  • Used in rotational delivery.
  • Most importantly used for delivery of occipitotransverse positions in a platypelloid pelvis.
  • It is an obsolete procedure.

questions.text: While assisting in the caesarean section of a multigravida, you see the senior obstetrician using the following instrument. Identify it.
questions.solution:
The given instrument is Green-Armytage forceps.

Its tips are broad and hence can compress a wide area. During lower segment caesarean section (LSCS), these forceps are applied at the bleeding cut uterine edges for hemostasis.

questions.text: An obstetrician performs an aspiration of the endometrial cavity in a woman with complaints of a missed period 2 weeks back. Identify the following instrument. What is the procedure it is used for?
questions.solution:
The instrument is Karman’s cannula and  syringe, which is also used for menstrual regulation.

Menstrual regulation is the aspiration of the endometrial cavity within 14 days of a missed period in a woman with a previous normal cycle.

Under aseptic precautions, the cervix may be gently dilated using 4-5 mm size dilators. Then 5-6mm Karman’s cannula is inserted and attached to a 50ml syringe for suction. The cannula is rotated, and pushed in and out with gentle strokes.

This procedure is contraindicated in advanced pregnancy and in the presence of local pelvic inflammation. The drawbacks of the procedure include a missed implanted zygote or an unrecognized ectopic pregnancy.

This procedure is not commonly done anymore.

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman at 9 weeks of gestation comes to the clinic for check-up following an MTP. On ultrasound, retained tissue was found and the following instrument was used for its removal. What is this instrument?
questions.solution:
The image shows a manual vacuum aspiration (MVA) syringe.

Manual vacuum aspiration can be safely done upto 12 weeks of gestation. However, WHO recommends it as the procedure of choice for MTP only upto 10 weeks of gestation . 

The indications of this procedure are given as follows:

  • Medical termination of pregnancy
  • Incomplete abortion or missed abortion
  • Molar pregnancy
  • Endometrial aspiration

questions.text: Identify the following instrument that is commonly used in a dilatation and curettage procedure.
questions.solution:
The given image shows Hegar's double-ended dilator which is used to dilate the cervix in dilation and curettage procedure. 

Pratt dilator is also a double-ended dilator but has a more linear shape as compared to the curved Hegar's dilators. The image given below shows a Pratt dilator.

 

Option A: Hawkin dilator is a single-ended dilator. The image given below shows a Hawkin dilator.

 

Option C: Bakes rosebud dilator is a single-ended dilator used to dilate the urethra. It is called so since its tip is similar to a rosebud. The image given below shows a Bakes dilator.

 

Option D: Fenton dilator is also double-ended but it has a notch in the middle. The image given below shows a Fenton dilator.

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presents with dyspareunia due to scarring secondary to perineal tears from previous vaginal delivery. The gynaecologist advises the use of the following dilator to widen the introitus. Identify this instrument.
questions.solution:
The image shows a Fenton dilator. These can be identified by the neck/notch at the centre.

Fenton's or modified Fenton's procedure is performed to widen the introitus in women with superficial dyspareunia secondary to scarring. The narrowing of introitus could be due to scarring secondary to perineal tears during childbirth or from conditions such as lichen sclerosus or vestibulitis.

Fenton dilators come in sizes numbered from 3-10 and the sizes of the dilators range from 3mm to 26mm.

Option B: Hawkins dilator is single-ended.

Options A and C: Hegar and Pratt dilators are also double-ended dilators but they do not have a notch at the centre. Pratt dilator is more linear in appearance compared to Hegar dilator.

questions.text: You have posted a 43-year-old woman with abnormal uterine bleeding for dilatation and curettage in the minor OT.  Identify the following instrument used in this procedure.
questions.solution:
The instrument shown in the image is Sim's curette. It is a single-ended uterine curette used for dilatation and curettage.

It is designed to remove tough tissue from the lining of the uterus for biopsy or excision. The curette features a sharp loop tip to aid in the removal of the uterine tissue.

questions.text: The following instrument is used for all except:
questions.solution:
The image shows a double-ended uterine curette with a sharp and a blunt end. It is not used in uterine length measurement.

Uterine length measurement is done with a uterine sound which is given below.

questions.text: Which of the following is a false statement about the instrument given below?

choices.text: It measures the uterine cavity and the cervical length
It differentiates between chronic inversion and fibroid polyp
It retracts the posterior vaginal wall to expose the cervix
It is used to diagnose cervical stenosis

questions.solution:
The given instrument is Simpson’s uterine sound. It is not used to retract the vagina for cervical examination. This is done using Sim's speculum.

The instrument is held like a pencil with the thumb and the first 2 fingers and introduced into the uterine cavity by keeping it in the midline and ensuring it is not forced.

The uses are given as follows:

  • To measure uterine cavity and cervical length
  • To diagnose cervical stenosis
  • To sound a polyp, IUCD or uterine septum
  • To break adhesions
  • To differentiate between chronic inversion and fibroid polyp

questions.text: You see a resident use the following instrument to grasp the anterior lip of the cervix in a patient posted for a vaginal hysterectomy. What is this instrument known as?
questions.solution:
The image shows vulsellum forceps. It is used to grasp the cervical lip and steady the cervix during vaginal surgery. It is a long instrument with a gentle curve so that the line of vision is not obstructed.

Option A: Allis forceps can be identified by continuous teeth, equal on both ends. It is used to hold structures with a firm grip.

Option C: Kocher's artery forceps are non-traumatic with a single tooth at the tip. They help in achieving hemostasis by firm pressure.

Option D: Lahey's tissue grasping forceps has teeth similar to dinner forks. They are used to hold fibrous tissue and they give a firm grip without slippage.

questions.text: Identify the following instrument.
questions.solution:
The given instrument is a towel-holding clip. It is used to secure drapings and towels during surgery.

Sponge-holding forceps are non-traumatic forceps. They are used for painting and preparation of parts preoperatively.

Filshie clips are used for laparoscopic tubal sterilisation. They are made of titanium on the outer side and sialistic material on the inner side.

questions.text: You are assisting a case of vaginal hysterectomy where your assistant professor asks you to hold the retractor shown in the image. What is this retractor known as?
questions.solution:
The image shown is that of a Simon vaginal retractor, used to retract vaginal walls during examination and vaginal procedures.

The below image is of Doyen's retractor. It is used during abdominal procedures like C-section.

questions.text: Identify the instrument.
questions.solution:
The instrument shown in the image is Auvard speculum. It retracts the posterior vaginal wall during vaginal hysterectomy and is self retractory due to the circular structure on its handle which is heavy.

The image given below shows Sim's speculum.

The image given below shows Cusco's self retaining bivalved speculum.

questions.text: Your senior resident uses the following instrument while performing a pap smear test for screening of cervical cancer in a 36-year-old woman. Identify the same.
questions.solution:
The image shows an endocervical brush. It is used to collect samples from the endocervix cervix, especially from deep lesions.

Option A: Cervex brush is ideal for collecting samples for liquid-based cytological studies.

Option C: Ayres spatula is used to collect samples from the ectocervix and the endocervix for cytological studies.

Option D: Aylesbury spatula has a sharper and longer tip than Ayers spatula.

questions.text: A 32-year-old working IT professional came for a mobile cervical cancer screening camp planned at her workplace. What is the following instrument used to perform this screening test?
questions.solution:
The given instrument used in the patient's pap smear preparation is Ayre's spatula. 

Sharpness on the end can differentiate between Ayre's and Aylesbury spatula. Aylesbury spatula has a more sharp and longer tip than Ayer's spatula. So, Aylesbury spatula is superior to Ayre's in collecting endocervical samples.

The image given below shows a slide holding bottle i.e. Kopliks jar with Ayre's spatula.

questions.text: A 35-year-old lady who had tested positive for HPV  is undergoing an investigation where the following device is used. Which of the following statements is false about this investigation?

choices.text: It is used in lithotomy position
Green filter is used to study vascular pattern
External os is visualised at a distance of 50 cm

questions.solution:
The device shown in the image is a colposcope. It is used to perform colposcopy where the cervix is visualized at a distance of around 20 cm with the patient in the lithotomy position.

This instrument provides binocular vision with a magnification of 6x-15x. A green filter is used to study vascular pattern as the vessels appear black. Abnormal areas can be identified by their peculiar vascular pattern such as mosaic, reticular, and punctate.

questions.text: The following instrument is used for a young lady with fibroids posted for open myomectomy. Identify it.
questions.solution:
The given image shows a Doyen myoma screw.

It is used to perform an open myomectomy. The handle present in this can be used to distinguish it from a laparoscopic myoma screw which also has a similar tip.

questions.text: Identify the use of the instrument given below:

choices.text: For ligation of uterine artery during hysterectomy

questions.solution:
The given instrument is a fallope ring applicator. It is used in tubal ligation. 

Falope ring sterilization is accomplished by applying silicone rubber bands to the fallopian tubes. The major advantage is the elimination of thermocoagulation. The occlusion is only in a short segment and can allow for tubal reconstruction.

Related Pearl: Instruments in OBG
